settings.richtext: Just as a person’s character and memory is nurtured into being over time and through a particular positioning in place, Saint Sithney Distilling Co is inherently conducive of its roots in the wild and ancient landscape of Cornwall. Nestled away on our coastal farmstead, after months of experimentation, the character of our flagship Cornish dry gin, Saint Sithney, was formed. A premium artisanal gin, Saint Sithney truly captures the spirit of Cornwall with its bold, original flavour profile and refreshing zest.

settings.Heading: CONNECT
settings.text: Follow us on social for the latest spirit releases, cocktails from mixologist and latest news.

settings.richtext: Our flagship gin, distilled on our historic Cornish farmstead from Cornish-grown wheat, and infused with botanicals from all corners of the globe. From earthy juniper berries to zesty kaffir lime leaves, orange and lemon peel; neatly rounded off with subtly aromatic coriander and cardamom.

settings.heading: WHERE TO FIND US
settings.text: There is something inherently entrepreneurial in the Cornish spirit, but always with an original flair and a vitality that reflects the energetic and wild landscape around us. Positioned on the South-East side of the Cornish peninsula between the historic towns of Helston and Breage, Sithney straggles the boundary between the Lizard peninsula with its marble-like serpentine cliffs, and the bold granite forms of Pen with to the South-West. This unique geography is reflected in the plethora of mines that pepper the landscape where our Saint Sithney distillery is based.

settings.heading: OUR ETHOS
settings.inline_richtext: Nestled away on a coastal Cornish farmstead, Saint Sithney Distilling Co. are the proud purveyors of Cornish spirit.
settings.inline_richtext_1: We understand that place is inherent in forming a unique identity and soul and Sithney is steeped in the heart and mettle of those that came before us. This wild land is a fertile bedrock that is imbued with history and legend, where art, technology, imagination and tenacity provide rich soil for seeds of inspiration and creation.
settings.inline_richtext_2: After months of experimentation, the character of our flagship Cornish dry gin, Saint Sithney, was formed. This resulted in a premium artisanal gin that truly captures the spirit of Cornwall with its bold, original flavour profile and refreshing citrus notes.

settings.heading: OUR STORY
settings.inline_richtext: Place and memory are inherently interlinked throughout the cornish landscape. At Sithney, the ancient and the modern meld in the present, creating links to the past and a grounding in place and identity.
settings.inline_richtext_1: Named after Saint Sithney who came to Cornwall as one of a band of Irish missionaries, it is through this linking of place and memory that the uniqueness….(talk about gin, the taste…etc). Legend states that God asked Sithney to be the patron saint of women seeking husbands, but Sithney retorted that he would never get any rest and so instead became the patron saint of mad dogs!
settings.inline_richtext_2: History is entrenched in every aspect of Sithney, even below the ground as the landscape is peppered with mines, some of which go back as far as Tudor times- the most renowned being the Great Wheal Fortune mine. Many generations of Cornishmen toiled in these pits, producing copper, zinc, arsenic, tungsten and tin. It is said that in the 1950s, a lone minor was seen to be working in the burrows, taking two sacks of Wolfram daily to the nearby village of Camborne to sell. And so, the wheel of fortune turns and, like the rotations of the hands of a clock, time has brought a new spirit of creativity and pride to the small parish - Saint Sithney Distilling co.

settings.heading: INGREDIENTS:
settings.text_6: gorse flowers and a sprig of mint or elderflower flowers to serve (optional)
settings.paragraph: Warning: do not consume the seeds of gorse flowers or the flowers in excess as they have been known to increase blood pressure when consumed in large quantities.
settings.text_11: Use a muddle to gently squash the lime, mint leaves, gorse flowers (if using), and honey together in the bottom of the glass.
settings.text_12: Add a handful of crushed ice to the glass and then pour the St Sithney Gin over the top. Stir everything together using the end of a straw.
settings.text_13: Top up the glass to the brim with another handful of crushed ice and pour over the soda or mineral water and the elderflower cordial.
settings.text_14: Add the straw and a final garnish of gorse flowers or elderflower flowers. Serve immediately.
